content: until you get to the last st double_crochet into the last st chain 1 and turn 2 r3 rs ● double_crochet into the first st and into every stitch across chain 1 and turn r4 ws to r38 76 ws ● repeat r2 and r3 until you get to the required amount of row above for my color block effect i switched colors after half the amount of row for stripes i would recommend switching colors every two row but of course go for whatever effect you are looking for here is how to change colors in crochet seaming ws ● with ws facing you slip_stitch all the sts of both sides together it should be easy to match up the sts and chain edge but if you are having trouble look at this video on slip_stitch seaming this is why we worked into the back loop of the chain so you had a cleaner edge to slip_stitch together you are to slip_stitch into both of the loops of the sts and chain edge ● when you are finished seaming all the sts in that fashion cut the yarn leaving a 6 tail and pull through the loop on your hook finishing ● weave in all the ends using your yarn needle ● block it and lay flat to dry thank you thank you for choosing my pattern you may sell as many of the finished items as you wish but i ask that if you share on social media you link the pattern to its source and give me credit @stopitharry on ravelry if you find any errors or have any questions please contact me @stopitharry on ravelry i hope you enjoy this pattern 3 4
